intro: Willdenowa glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with prominent veins and often bear glandular structures. Willdenowa glandulosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
